1.heading: Baily, Bernard, 1916-1996.
1.title: "Adventure in England"
1.author: by Bernard Bailey
1.appears_in: 12 p. in Action Comics, no. 1 (June 1938) ; reprinted in Famous First Edition #C-26 (1974).
notes: Data from Gene Reed.

2.heading: Baily, Bernard, 1916-1996.
2.title: All Star Comics Archives. v. 3
2.author: foreword by Roy Thomas.
notes: (DC Archive Editions)
Collects the Justice Society and Hop Harrigan stories from All Star Comics #11-14 (1942-1943).

Stories in this collection were written by Gardner Fox and Sheldon Mayer, and drawn by Jack Burnley, Sheldon Moldoff, Harry G. Peter, Cliff Young, Ben Flinton, Howard Sherman, Stan Asch, Bernard Klein, Bernard Baily, Joe Gallagher, Lou Ferstadt, Pierce Rice, Jack Kirby, Joe Simon, and Howard Ferguson. Editors are Sheldon Mayer and Ted Udall. Brief biographies are presented at the end of the volume.

3.heading: Baily, Bernard, 1916-1996.
3.title: All Star Comics Archives. v. 4
3.author: foreword by James Robinson.
notes: (DC Archive Editions)
Collects the Justice Society stories from All Star Comics #15-18 (1943).

Stories in this collection are written by Gardner Fox and Sheldon Mayer, and drawn by Joe Gallagher, Sheldon Moldoff, Stan Asch, Joe Simon, Jack Kirby, Ed Dobrotka, Bernard Baily, Howard Sherman, Paul Reinman, Pierce Rice, and Arthur Cazeneuve, with covers by Frank Harry. Editors are Sheldon Mayer and Dorothy Roubicek. Brief biographies are presented at the end of the volume.

4.heading: Baily, Bernard, 1916-1996.
4.title: All Star Comics Archives. v. 5
4.author: foreword by R
notes: (DC Archive Editions)
Collects the Justice Society and Hop Harrigan stories from All Star Comics, no. 19-23 (1943-1944).

Stories in the collection are written by Gardner Fox and Sheldon Mayer, and drawn by Joe Gallagher, Stan Aschmeier, Joe Simon, Jack Kirby, Bernard Baily, Sheldon Moldoff, and Joe Kubert, with one cover by Frank Harry. Editors are Sheldon Mayer and Dorothy Roubicek. Brief biographies are presented at the end of the volume.

23.heading: Baily, Bernard, 1916-1996.
23.title: "Tick-Tock Tyler the Hour-Man"
23.author: Gardner Fox, script ; Bernard Baily, art
23.appears_in: 6 p. in Adventure Comics, no. 48 (Mar. 1940) ; reprinted in Justice League of America, no. 96 (Feb. 1972).
notes: The title "Origin of the Hourman"* supplied for this story in the Grand Comics Database, and the title "First Adventure"* was assigned by Gene Reed in earlier indexing.
Introduction and origin of The Hourman (Rex Tyler). Villains are John Kennedy, Randall, and Patsy ; also introduced are Joan Kennedy, her son, Marsha Van Shelton, and Mr. Bannerman.
An extended version of this origin story appears in Secret Origins III, no. 16.
Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.

96.heading: Baisden, Greg S.
96.title: "Eight Top Creators Petition Innovation : False Light Advertising Claimed"
96.author: Greg S
96.appears_in: Baisden. p. 16-19 in The Comics Journal, no. 130 (July 1989)
notes: Begins: "Terry Austin, John Byrne, Howard Chaykin, John Jay Muth, Trina Robbins, P. Craig Russell, Alex Toth, and Charles Vess have formally complained to Innovation Comics about advertisements they claim misrepresent them as Innovation freelancers." A published ad showing the cover of Voyages, and listing its contributors, was for an Innovation reissue of a 1983 book (published by Nautilus Dreams), and the reissue didn't actually appear. Paul Curtis responds for Innovation.
